__TOC__

If you are joining the Ubuntu-X Bug Swat Team, welcome aboard!

=== Getting Started Checklist ===

==== The Basics ====
# Join the <nowiki>[[https://edge.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-x-swat|Ubuntu-X Swat Team]]</nowiki> in launchpad
# Join the <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/Ubuntu-x|ubuntu-x mailing list]]</nowiki> (low traffic)
# Join (optionally) the ubuntu-x-swat@ list for bug traffic (extremely HIGH traffic - use e-mail filters)
# Join #ubuntu-x on irc.libera.chat
# Add yourself to the Ubuntu-X Hardware list (below)
# Update your system to latest Ubuntu
** Stable Updates: https://edge.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-x-swat/+archive/x-updates
** Unstable Bleeding-Edge: https://edge.launchpad.net/~xorg-edgers/+archive/ppa

==== Ubuntu-X Bug Triagers ====

# Read <nowiki>[[Bugs-Status]]</nowiki>
# Review the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Debugging|Ubuntu-X Debugging Guide]]</nowiki>
# Review the <nowiki>[[https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-x-swat/+packagebugs|packages Ubuntu-X maintains]]</nowiki> and pick your initial area of focus
# Work towards gaining <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugControl|Ubuntu Bug Control]]</nowiki> membership

==== Ubuntu-X Packagers ====

# Get an account on <nowiki>[[http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/AccountRequests|freedesktop]]</nowiki>, our main upstream
# Establish an Xorg build environment using <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PbuilderHowto|pbuilder]]</nowiki>
# Learn how to <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/DriverBuilding|Build debs of X drivers]]</nowiki>
# Learn the Ubuntu-X team's <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/GitUsage|use of Git for version control]]</nowiki>
# Learn <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PackagingGuide|Debian packaging]]</nowiki>
# Work towards gaining <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MOTU/GettingStarted|MOTU]]</nowiki> membership
